problem.title: CheckPoint: Collision in 2D
problem.script: m1=random.choice([0.5,2,5]) v1=random.choice([0.4,1.2,2.5]) m2=random.choice([0.5,2,5]) v2=random.choice([0.4,1.2,2.5]) v=math.sqrt(( m1* v1)*( m1* v1)+( m2* v2)*( m2* v2))/( m1+ m2)
problem.p: Two spheres move in perpendicular directions on a horizontal frictionless table. Their masses and velocities are: $m1 kg; $v1 m/s and $m2 kg; $v2 m/s. The spheres collide inelastically (they stick to each other) and slide together on the table after the collision.
Part 1. Consider the system to be both spheres. Is the momentum of the system conserved during the collision? Choose the best answer.

choice.name: foil2
choice.text: No, because the collision is not elastic

choice.name: foil3
choice.text: No, because the spheres interact with the table

choice.name: foil4
choice.text: No, because the spheres interact with the Earth

choice.name: foil5
choice.text: No, because the spheres move in different directions before the collision

problem.p: Part 2. During the collision, which of the spheres experiences a greater impulse?

choice.name: foil1
choice.text: Neither; each sphere experiences zero impulse

choice.name: foil2
choice.text: Neither: each sphere experiences a non-zero impulse of the same magnitude

choice.name: foil3
choice.text: The sphere with the greater mass

choice.name: foil4
choice.text: The sphere with the greater initial speed

choice.name: foil5
choice.text: The sphere with the greater initial momentum

choice.name: foil6
choice.text: The sphere with the smaller mass

choice.name: foil7
choice.text: The sphere with the smaller initial speed

choice.name: foil8
choice.text: The sphere with the smaller initial momentum

problem.p: Part 3. What is the speed of the spheres after the collision?
